item.title: Sarah’s first Camping
item.dc:creator: doug
item.description: Well no bears this time, and no pictures yet either. We had a fun time at our annual first camping of the year, and Sarah had a blast. The weather was perfect. Everything went great. Josh was a great big brother showing Sarah the ropes and introducing her to everyone. One of the highlights was [...]<script type="text/javascript">SHARETHIS.addEntry({ title: "Sarah’s first Camping", url: "http://www.dougma.com/archives/91" });</script>

item.title: The Hague Decloration
item.dc:creator: doug
item.description: Andy Updegrove has just posted about The Hague Decloration. I received a phone call about it this morning, and I believe it is one of the most important declarations on human rights to come along in quite some time. Please go read up on this. It may at first appear that technology and the standards [...]<script type="text/javascript">SHARETHIS.addEntry({ title: "The Hague Decloration", url: "http://www.dougma.com/archives/90" });</script>

item.title: Generosity of the Python Community
item.dc:creator: doug
item.description: Steve Holden is participating in the 5K Race for Hope. He is looking for people to sponsor his run. Lets show the other groups the generosity of the Python Community! (Sorry Team Hopkins, Steve got to me first ) If Steve is willing to go the full 5K distance, we should be able to support [...]<script type="text/javascript">SHARETHIS.addEntry({ title: "Generosity of the Python Community", url: "http://www.dougma.com/archives/88" });</script>

item.title: Limit Exceeded
item.dc:creator: doug
item.description: Hmm…. I know I should be more concerned about what this says about my internet useage: You have exceeded your 1027.63 gigabyte download limit You have downloaded a total of 1027.67 gigabytes. <script type="text/javascript">SHARETHIS.addEntry({ title: "Limit Exceeded", url: "http://www.dougma.com/archives/87" });</script>

item.title: Ray Ozzie, Microsoft and Open Source
item.dc:creator: doug
item.description: I was going to write a reaction to Ray Ozzie’s comments on Microsoft and Open Source. First off this is a blog post which just quotes some of his comments. One must be careful when that happens, and I would prefer to read an entire transcript. Still there is enough context there to work with. [...]<script type="text/javascript">SHARETHIS.addEntry({ title: "Ray Ozzie, Microsoft and Open Source", url: "http://www.dougma.com/archives/86" });</script>

item.title: GitS: The Coming Abomination (in 3-D!)
item.dc:creator: doug
item.description: I was having a decent enough day until this came across my rss reader: DreamWorks Acquires Rights for Ghost in the Shell And another of my favorite franchises gets mutated, warped and ruined. “But it’s DreamWorks and Spielburg“, you say. Exactly. Not only do I get to see something I love destroyed, I get to watch DreamWorks [...]<script type="text/javascript">SHARETHIS.addEntry({ title: "GitS: The Coming Abomination (in 3-D!)", url: "http://www.dougma.com/archives/85" });</script>

item.title: Google App Engine: The good, the bad, and the ugly?
item.dc:creator: doug
item.description: I have been holding off on writing this post as I prefer to fully form an opinion. At the writing of this there are almost 600 blog posts about the new google hosted application. Most seem to me to be flailing around the actual core of what this new little beastie is. Some are comparing it [...]<script type="text/javascript">SHARETHIS.addEntry({ title: "Google App Engine: The good, the bad, and the ugly?", url: "http://www.dougma.com/archives/84" });</script>

item.title: Randall Munroe Rules!
item.dc:creator: doug
item.description:
It’s like someone peered into my 3am brain and drew what they saw. Randall: you forgot the farside chicken perched on the tree, but besides that, spot on! Spot On!!
<script type="text/javascript">SHARETHIS.addEntry({ title: "Randall Munroe Rules!", url: "http://www.dougma.com/archives/83" });</script>

item.title: Shell History
item.dc:creator: doug
item.description: Because all the cool kids are doing it: history|awk ‘{a[$2]++ } END{for(i in a){print a[i] ” ” i}}’ |sort -rn|head New laptop: 44 ls 37 cd 18 svn 16 netstat 13 ping 9 ssh 6 nslookup 4 python 4 mv 4 man PyCon Server: 314 cd 82 ps 78 ls 68 tail 67 svn 59 exit 52 grep 40 uptime 38 touch 32 python2.5 Work (this can’t be right, my .cshrc must be set to keep everything for ever [...]<script type="text/javascript">SHARETHIS.addEntry({ title: "Shell History", url: "http://www.dougma.com/archives/82" });</script>
